item.title: Stardew Valley Player Only Discovers Helpful Feature after Three Game Years
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Some players overlook useful features in Stardew Valley, like those of upgraded tools, due to lack of tutorials.
  • Upgrades to tools like watering can and hoe can significantly reduce time spent on farming tasks.
  • Stardew Valley has hidden mechanics, such as regaining energy by lying in bed in multiplayer mode.

A Stardew Valley player missed out on a helpful feature in the game for three in-game years. Other Stardew Valley players have shared in their commiseration, with some noting that they were oblivious to various helpful elements of the game themselves for far too long.

Stardew Valley isn't a difficult game to learn, but mastering Stardew Valley is an entirely different matter. The game doesn't force players through lengthy tutorials to introduce every single element of the game, so some fans can end up overlooking details and functions that could have been helpful early on.

Reddit user and Stardew Valley player midnightbake is one of those people, who shared how they didn't know that the upgraded watering can can water more crops at once. For three of Stardew Valley 's years, they apparently watered their crops one-by-one or relied on sprinklers, despite having upgraded the tool. While it might strike some fans as a simplistic thing to overlook, some players noted that they had also been confused when they upgraded the watering can because of its capacity. Upgrading the watering can with Clint allows farmers to use it more per refill, so it seems some players thought the improvements ended there.

Players Have Similar Issues With Other Stardew Valley Tools

Some Stardew Valley players apparently didn't even bother upgrading some tools like the hoe, not knowing that it, too, can handle more than one square of dirt at once. This works in the same way as the watering can, as all players have to do is hold down the action key. A grid will appear on the ground, indicating where the earth will be watered or tilled, depending on the tool being used. Further upgrades expand the size of the grid, which can significantly shorten the amount of time needed to set up one's crops at the start of a Stardew Valley season.

While realizing a helpful detail like this was overlooked for so long might embarrass some players, many of the smaller details of Stardew Valley get missed. For example, some players didn't know about Stardew Valley 's fishing channel, or that it's possible to regain energy in multiplayer mode via lying one's bed without sleeping for the night. Some fans consider using resources like the wiki or Stardew Valley guides to be a must playing the game due to the number of hidden mechanics and unspoken resources in the game.

Thankfully, Stardew Valley is a game that many fans enjoy playing for years on end, or who regularly revisit to start a new farm. While the player may have missed out on the watering can's full capabilities during their first three years, from this point on, farming should be a lot easier for them.

item.title: 7 Best Anime With Survival Games
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Anime includes suspenseful survival games with high stakes for characters, creating intense and bloody storylines.
  • Some survival game anime like "Magical Girl Raising Project" involve contestants fighting to keep their powers and survive.
  • Shows like "Gantz" and "Deadman Wonderland" showcase characters battling for survival against monstrous beings and deadly games.

Anime is open to all kinds of genres, not just action, comedy, and romance. Suspense and thriller stories also have a place in anime, and stories about games with a lot on the line are incredibly popular. Sometimes, however, it's not just about money or pride, but the contestants' lives themselves, making for an incredibly tense watch for fans.

Survival games where failure can mean death aren't the most popular anime, but they can make for a suspenseful watch as fans worry about whether their favorite character is going to survive the episode. Here are some of the best anime centered around survival games, ranked.

7 Magical Girl Raising Project

A Culling Of Heroines

  • Studio: Lerche
  • Number Of Episodes: 12
  • Available On: Crunchyroll, Funimation

Middle school student Koyuki Himekawa discovers that the mobile game Magical Girl Raising Project has a big secret. Very rarely, a player is chosen to become a real magical girl by the mascot, Fav. Becoming the magical girl Snow White, Koyuki feels as if she's accomplished her dream, but there soon arrives an announcement that there are too many magical girls. Competitions will be held to decide who loses their powers.

While it all seems relatively benign at first, the magical girls soon realize that losing their powers also means dying. With their lives now on the line, the magical girls begin fighting to maintain their powers and for survival, resulting in a bloodbath that belies the anime's seemingly cute premise.

6 Gantz

Gamifying The Protection Of Earth

Kei Kurono and Masaru Kato get hit by a train while attempting to rescue a drunk man. To their surprise, they do not die, but instead awake in an empty apartment with several other people. They soon learn that they have been selected by a being called Gantz to fight against strange otherworldly monsters, and are given a variety of equipment and weapons to do so. They earn points for every kill they make, and if they can earn enough points, they can return to their normal lives.

Gantz follows the players and their struggle for survival against the monstrous beings they are called on to fight. Deaths are common, and most missions end with a sizable body count.

5 Deadman Wonderland

A Deadly Prison Sentence

Ganta Igarashi is the only survivor of a massacre that slaughters his entire class. Framed for the murder, Ganta is sent to a prison known as Deadman Wonderland, which doubles as an entertainment park for the rich and corrupt. Fitted with a collar that injects poison into his veins, Ganta can only survive by eating a candy-like medicine, which he can only obtain by participating in the prison's many deadly games.

Deadman Wonderland paints a unique picture of a bizarre prison where a prisoner's life is constantly on the line. While the tension of Ganta losing his life is a constant factor, the story puts more focus on the mystery of the person who truly killed Ganta's classmates, as well as the unique powers the prisoners gain while in the prison.

4 Danganronpa: The Animation

A Class Trial Of Truth And Betrayal

Makoto Naegi is excited about going to Hope's Peak Academy, where the brightest and most talented high school students attend. His excitement is dampened by the sudden appearance of Monokuma, who declares that the students are all being imprisoned at the academy for the rest of their lives, and that they can only leave if they kill another student without getting caught. Though the students initially refuse to do such a thing, the bloody class trials soon begin nevertheless.

Danganronpa: The Animation is an anime adaptation of the first Danganronpa video game, and is fairly faithful to the original story. The anime mixes murder-mystery with fist-clenching suspense, making for quite an intense watch.

3 Darwin's Game

Survival Game In The Real World

Kaname Sudo receives an invitation from his friend to join something called Darwin's Game. When he does, he finds himself thrown into a real-world survival game, where one wrong move means death. Having already lost two friends to the game, Kaname decides to find the game's creator and stop Darwin's Game once and for all.

Darwin's Game is a straightforward survival game story, where losing means death. With supernatural powers to mix up the action, Darwin's Game can feel like a battle manga at times, but the stakes are still plenty high.

2 Btooom!

A Popular Video Game Realized In Reality

Ryota Sakamoto is one of the top players in a video game called Btooom! , where the main weapons to use are bombs and explosives. He spends his days playing the game constantly, until he one day awakens on a deserted island with a collection of bomb-like weapons on him. He soon realizes that he has found himself in a real-life version of Btooom! , and must find some way to survive.

Btooom! is more pure survival than other anime that feature survival games, although there are still game-like elements to the story. The anime is intense and full of action, making it both exciting and incredibly tense.

1 Future Diary

The Competition To Become God

Yukiteru Amano is a loner with no friends, other than his imaginary friend Deus Ex Machina. One day, his phone starts recording events that haven't happened yet, which are surprisingly accurate. He soon finds out that his imaginary friend is not so imaginary, and is in fact the God of Space and Time. Deus is looking for a successor, and has given several people Future Diaries in the form of cell phones. Losing their Future Diary will kill them, and the one remaining winner will be allowed to succeed him as God.

Future Diary was fairly popular when it first released, due to it featuring the yandere heroine Yuno Gasai. The series has an interesting take on the survival game concept, and its bloody and violent story has led to its popularity.

item.title: Baldur's Gate 3 Fan Creates LEGO Versions of the Game's Characters
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • A fan recreated Baldur's Gate 3 characters in LEGO.
  • The intricate LEGO recreations drew positive responses from fans, sparking requests for more.
  • New D&D rules updates and a major Baldur's Gate 3 Patch 7 release are on the horizon.

A Baldur’s Gate 3 fan has recreated some of the game’s popular characters by using LEGO. On its release in 2023, Baldur’s Gate 3 became a hit with fans and critics, setting multiple records for players on Steam and winning multiple Game of the Year awards.

The RPG is based in the world of Dungeons and Dragons , and players can meet an eclectic cast of characters. Players even have the option to romance a lot of the NPCs in Baldur’s Gate 3 , along with the flexibility to approach any situation however they want. One player has taken inspiration from this level of freedom and has come up with a clever way of taking the more popular characters in Baldur’s Gate 3 and recreating them in the real world.

One fan who goes by the username of Lopiz38 on Reddit has recreated some of the memorable characters from Baldur’s Gate 3 in LEGO form by only using bricks found in the recently released LEGO Dungeons and Dragons Minifigure collection. The post shows Shadowheart, Karlach, Gale, Lae’zel, Wyll, Withers, and Astarion from the game all recreated as recognizable LEGO minifigures that come complete with similar-looking items and weapons found within Baldur’s Gate 3 . Lopiz38 rounds off the collection with their own version of Tav, the default player character.

Popular Baldur's Gate 3 Characters Have Been Recreated Using LEGOs

At the time of writing, the replies to the post have been positive, with most replies praising how well Lopiz38 was able to recreate the characters from Baldur’s Gate 3 in such detail. Fans have already requested that the OP tackle other characters from the game, such as Minthara. The original poster sadly confirmed this wasn’t possible owing to the lack of materials from the sets to create an accurate representation.

There is no word of whether an official collaboration between Baldur’s Gate 3 and LEGO will ever happen, but there are still exciting developments coming to D&D that fans can look forward to. Wizards of the Coast are set to update the core rules of Dungeons and Dragons for the first time in 10 years. The new game is set to refresh almost all character classes, along with giving players greater flexibility on what can be done with their characters.

For gamers still exploring the world of Baldur’s Gate 3 , a major update will be available in the coming days. Larian is releasing Patch 7 for Baldur's Gate 3 on PC, before rolling it out to Mac and console players. The patch will bring new features, including a new ending to the Dark Urge storyline and the long-awaited player mods.

item.title: Steam Deck: How To Run PS2 Games With EmuDeck
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Preparations For EmuDeck On The Steam Deck
  • How To Install EmuDeck On The Steam Deck For PS2 Games
  • How To Transfer Bios And ROM Files On The Emudeck
  • How To Add PS2 Games To The Steam Library

The versatility of the Steam Deck extends far beyond being a handheld gaming device. It can function as a working desktop PC running its built-in Linux OS, or players can use it as a retro gaming device to play classic games using an emulation program.

Thanks to the EmuDeck app, gamers can even use the Steam Deck to run PlayStation 2 games. With the EmuDeck, Steam Deck users can add their games to their Steam library - complete with artwork and game covers. For those unsure of what the process entails, here's how to run PS2 games on the Steam Deck .

Updated September 4, 2024, by Michael Llewellyn: The PS2 emulator is a powerful progam that works beautifully through the EmuDeck program. The EmuDeck program allows users to run multiple emulators at once and play their favorite games via the Steam Deck's Gaming Mode. However, with the handheld receiving frequent updates, players must enable Developer Mode to maintain the program's functionality. As such, this guide has been updated to include the steps that must be followed to install Developer Mode on the Steam Deck.

Preparations For EmuDeck On The Steam Deck

Before attempting to install the EmuDeck app on the Steam Deck, users should be prepared to make the installation go smoothly. Obtain the following items before installing EmuDeck:

  • High-speed A2 Micro SD card: It's recommended to use a high-speed SD card to protect the Steam Deck's internal SSD.
  • PlayStation 2 ROMS and Bios files: Players legally own digital ROMS of games they own. The Bios files are also needed to run the PS2 games and can be found with a quick search on Google.
  • Keyboard and mouse: Using a keyboard and mouse is optional, but using the Steam Deck in Desktop Mode is a better experience with a keyboard.

Enable Developer Mode

To ensure EmuDeck and any related plugins are functioning correctly, it's a good idea to enable Developer Mode in the Steam Deck's settings. Use the following steps to enable Developer Mode:

  • Press the Steam button and open the System menu.
  • Enable Developer Mode .
  • Then open the new Developer menu.
  • In the Developer menu, switch CEF Debugging on .
  • Press the Steam button again and select Power .
  • Switch to Desktop Mode to install the EmuDeck program to get PS2 games working on the Steam Deck.

Be sure to check the Developer Mode settings after every major update. These updates can occasionally switch off CEF Debugging by default. Major updates for the Steam Deck are less frequent in Stable mode, whereas Beta mode, which provides early access to settings and tools still in development, receives updates more frequently.

How To Install EmuDeck On The Steam Deck For PS2 Games

Use the following steps to install the EmuDeck on the Steam Deck:

  • Press the Steam button below the left trackpad.
  • Select the Power option.
  • Switch to Desktop Mode .
  • Open a preferred browser and download EmuDeck using this link.
  • Select the SteamOS version and download it. After EmuDeck has downloaded, double-click the installer to begin the installation.
  • Select Custom Install .
  • On the EmuDeck menu, select the SD card image.
  • The EmuDeck will list a range of emulators. The emulator needed for PS2 games is called the PCSX2 . Check the PCSX2 or add more to try emulators.
  • Ensure the Steam Rom Manager is selected, too. This will display the games on the main Steam library.
  • Skip along the options, and enable the Configure CRT Shader for Classic 3D Games option .
  • Select Finish to finalize the installation.

How To Transfer Bios And ROM Files On The Emudeck

With the legally obtained ROMs and the Bios files downloaded, it's time to manually place them in their correct folders on the Steam Deck. The Bios are needed to allow the emulator to run the games flawlessly.

Bios Files

  • Open the Dolphin file manager in Desktop Mode.
  • Access the EmuDeck installation on the SD card by selecting Primary .
  • Click on Emulation .
  • Select Bios .
  • Then, transfer the Bios files into the folder.

ROM Files

  • Open the Emulation folder and select ROMS .
  • Locate the folder labeled PS2 .
  • Then transfer the PS2 ROMS into that folder.

How To Add PS2 Games To The Steam Library

With the Bios and PS2 ROM files in their correct folders. It's time to add the games to the Steam Deck library. Use the following steps to add PS2 games to the Steam library with their correct artwork and covers:

  • Open the EmuDeck app
  • Select Steam Rom Manager.

The Steam Rom Manager program places emulated games into the Steam library.

  • Click Yes to launch the Steam Rom Manager.
  • Scroll down and highlight and select Sony PlayStation 2 - PCSX2 .
  • Then, in the Parsers menu , click Add Game .
  • The desired emulator should turn white.
  • The EmuDeck will add the games and their artwork to the Steam library.
  • Check if there is any missing artwork. If not, select Save to Steam .

Fix Missing Artwork

In most cases, Steam Rom Manager will allocate the correct artwork for an emulated game. However, there are occasions when the artwork will be blank, or it will have added the incorrect image file. Use the following steps to fix missing artwork:

  • If the game features the wrong artwork, click on the Fix icon.
  • Type the game's title in the Fix Artwork and Title search bar .
  • Select one of the game covers and click it.
  • Click on Save and close.

Uploading Missing Artwork

It's possible that some game covers will be missing from the Steam Rom Manager, or maybe the Steam Deck user would prefer to upload their own. To upload an image from the game's files, use the following steps:

  • With the Steam Deck in Desktop Mode, use a browser and a search engine to find a game cover.
  • Click images. Then, save the cover to the Pictures folder on the Steam Deck.
  • Or, add a custom game cover and save it to the Pictures folder instead.
  • Open EmuDeck and Steam Rom Manager.
  • Click on Upload on the game's frame.
  • Open the Pictures folder and select the new cover image.
  • Select Save and Close .

With the artwork uploaded, follow the next steps to ensure the games are uploaded to the Steam library:

  • Select Save to Steam .
  • When the process has finished, close the Steam Rom Manager and switch back to Gaming Mode .
  • In Gaming Mode, press the Steam button.
  • Select Library and select the new tab labeled Collections .
  • The new PS2 games will appear in the PS2 tab.
  • The games will launch from the Steam library like an official game.

Saving The Game

You can save your PS2 game progress using the in-game method by default or by utilizing the emulator's save-anywhere system.

  • Double-click on the screen to open the emulator's menu screen.
  • Click System .
  • Click Save State .
  • Save the game to one of the empty save slots.
  • To load the game, select System .
  • Load State and select the saved slot.

Improving Visual Quality

It's possible to improve the visual fidelity of some PS2 games and reduce the jaggy outlines. This can be done via the following steps, but players should be aware that the results can vary for some titles.

  • Double-tap the screen to access the emulator's settings menu.
  • Select Graphics .
  • Put a check on the FXAA option for anti-aliasing.
  • In the dropdown menu next to Contrast Adaptive Sharpening, select Sharpen Only .

If games are running slow, press the QAS button under the right trackpad, highlight the Performance menu, increase the Frame Limit to 60 FPS , and toggle Use per-game profile on.

item.title: New York Times Connections Hints and Answers for #452 September 5, 2024
item.description:
Connections is back with another selection of words to put into groups. In order to win this one, you will need to know all the words and something about each of the categories without knowing what they are. Then, you need to sort all these words into the categories before running out of the four mistakes you get.

But today's puzzle is even more difficult than the rules of Connections might suggest; this one has some challenging categories and words in it. If you are stuck, you can find spoilers, hints, and other helpful tips in the article below.

Words in the NYT Connections Puzzle #452 for September 5, 2024

The Connections puzzle for today contains the words: Clown, Dwell, Turkey, Sea, Wonder, Sap, Dwindle, Stay, Decline, Dweeb, Ebb, Live, Sin, Inhabit, Dwarf, and Drop.

What is the Definition of Dweeb?

Dweeb is a slang word in English that is a derogatory name to call someone, usually meaning nerdy or weak.

What is the Definition of Dwindle?

Dwindle is a word that means to get smaller or "to fall away, as in quality; degenerate," according to Dictionary.com.

Hints for the NYT Connections Puzzle

If you want some hints for this innovative puzzle game, you can find them below. In these sections, there are spoilers, category clues, general hints, and more.

Some General Hints for the Whole Connections Puzzle

Yellow NYT Connections Category Hints

Yellow Connections Category Answer

Yellow Connections Category Answer and All Four Words

Green NYT Connections Category Hints

Green Connections Category Answer

Green Connections Category Answer and All Four Words

Blue NYT Connections Category Hints

Blue Connections Category Answer

Blue Connections Category Answer and All Four Words

Purple NYT Connections Category Hints

Purple Connections Category Answer

Purple Connections Category Answer and All Four Words

Answers for Today's NYT Connections #452 for September 5, 2024

If you are searching for the full answer to this challenging puzzle game, you can find it in the section below. It contains all the categories and the words that belong in each one.

Want to play? Check out the New York Times Games Connections website available on almost any device with a browser.
